column4: not sure in kubuntu, but in ubuntu, you have to tell gnome-open what programs that should be opened with the diffrent extentions

Are you talking about default applciations? Because Frifox is set to be my default applicaiton, but when in firefox I have downlaoded a file and want to open the destination directory, it does nto do so
no, not default application like that. In firefox:  Edit-->Preferences--> Content --> (File Type) Manage
sorry, that was wrong place. Not sure where you do it. I use Opera ;)
But that is for mp3 files and flash and otehr
there is probably a default application that tries to open all the files
the problem is that firefox needs to communicate with knoqueror and tell it to open up the directory
what happens when you try to open a file ?
what happens when you tries to open the same file with the program that browses the folders and files on your system?
if nothing happens there either, then you have to set it up in that program.
if that works, then you have to figure out how you can set firefox default to open files in that file viewer. (which is called gnome-open in gnome)
gnome-open in gnome where in Ubuntu do you do that? Is that ?
I'll see if I can find somethig in Ubuntu forums
you can also try #kubuntu or #kde Probably more than you that has this problem
